Context:
Program Name: Media Acting - Graduate Intensive
Code: P707
Credential: George Brown College Certificate
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 7 weeks
Starting Months: July
Domestic Tuition: $2,300.00*
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Media & Performing Arts
Location: St. James Campus
Courses included in the program: voice-over, animation, combat for film, new technology acting, auditioning for film
Each week includes a daily on-camera acting class and a weekly guest lecture series featuring professional directors, producers, actors and agents.
Program Availability: Open for Spring 2024 for domestic students. Not available for international students or for the Fall 2023 and Winter 2024 semesters.
Related programs: Acting for Media (P107), Theatre Arts – Performance (P104), Theatre Arts-Preparation (P108)

Context:
Program Offered: Acting and Media Production (Graduate)
Courses: ACTS 7002 - Creating Your Own Work, ACTS 7006 - Audition Techniques, ACTS 7008 - New Technology Acting, ACTS 7009 - Voice-over Characterization, ACTS 7010 - Acting for the Camera, ACTS 7015 - Combat for Film, ACTS 7016 - Commercial Auditioning, ACTS 7019 - Animation Voicing, ACTS 7050 - Guest Lecture Series
Program Learning Outcomes: Ability to present oneself for employment as a professional actor, develop believable characters, convey and sustain truth of character using technical skills, work collaboratively with industry professionals, and develop strategies for personal, career and professional development.
Tuition & Fees: Domestic Tuition - $2,300.00* (*Amounts listed are the total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees)
Financial Assistance: Not eligible for OSAP funding
Admission Requirements: Applicants must be graduates of a two- or three-year Theatre Acting diploma or a three- or four-year degree in acting or theatre (Equity members).
Application Process: Apply directly through the School of Media and Performing Arts at George Brown College by filling out the application form.
Contact Information: School of Media & Performing Arts, Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 2015, Email: media@georgebrown.ca
